Package Classes

Class Appointment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Classes.Appointment
  • public class Appointment
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates the Appointment object which is used to track appointments. This class also contains methods to manage appointments.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • Appointment

        public Appointment​(int Appointment_ID,
                   java.lang.String Title,
                   java.lang.String Description,
                   java.lang.String Location,
                   java.lang.String Type,
                   java.time.ZonedDateTime Start,
                   java.time.ZonedDateTime End,
                   int Customer_ID,
                   int User_ID,
                   int Contact_ID)
        This method is the Constructor for the object.
        Parameters:
        Appointment_ID - Unique identifier for Appointment.
        Title - What the Appointment is called.
        Description - A more detailed description of what the Appointment is about.
        Location - Where the Appointment is taking place.
        Type - What kind of Appointment this is.
        Start - What time and date the Appointment will start.
        End - What time and date the Appointment will end.
        Customer_ID - Unique identifier for Customer that the Appointment is for.
        User_ID - Unique identifier for the User that the Appointment is for.
        Contact_ID - Unique identifier for the Contact that the Appointment is for.

        Parameters:

      • dateValidator

        public static boolean dateValidator​(java.lang.String date)
        This method validates if a string is a valid date and time in the format of the database.
        Parameters:
        date - The String to be tested.
        Returns:
        Whether the String is a valid date or not.

      • inHoursValidator

        public static boolean inHoursValidator​(java.time.ZonedDateTime timeStart,
                                       java.time.ZonedDateTime timeEnd)
        This method checks if an Appointment is within working hours of the company.
        Parameters:
        timeStart - The Start time and date of the Appointment.
        timeEnd - The End time and date of the Appointment.
        Returns:
        Whether the Appointment is within working hours or not.

      • selfOverlapValidator

        public static boolean selfOverlapValidator​(java.time.ZonedDateTime timeStart,
                                           java.time.ZonedDateTime timeEnd)
        This method validates that an Appointments Start is before it's End.
        Parameters:
        timeStart - The Start of the Appointment.
        timeEnd - The End of the Appointment.
        Returns:
        Whether the Start and End times are set up in a valid order.

      • overlapValidator

        public static boolean overlapValidator​(int CustomerID,
                                       java.time.ZonedDateTime startTime,
                                       java.time.ZonedDateTime endTime,
                                       int AppointmentID)
        This method validates that the Customer does not have any conflicting Appointments.
        Parameters:
        CustomerID - The ID of the Customer to check.
        startTime - The Start Time of the Appointment.
        endTime - The End Time of the Appointment.
        AppointmentID - The ID of the Appointment. This makes sure it does not check for overlap with itself.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Customer has no conflicting Appointments.
